message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.MED, cs.AI, cs.MM 

The paper proposes a learning-based approach for motion correction in cardiac MR images, which involves generating probabilistic segmentation maps using decision forests and registering them to a target map. This approach involves computer vision (CV) techniques such as segmentation and registration, and machine learning (ML) techniques such as decision forests. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also involves ML techniques for motion correction, which makes cs.LG (Machine Learning) a likely sub-category as well. The paper is focused on medical imaging and specifically on cardiac MR images, which makes cs.MED (Medical Imaging) a likely sub-category. The paper also involves AI techniques for motion correction, which makes cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper involves multimedia (MM) techniques for motion correction, which makes cs.MM (Multimedia) a possible sub-category as well.
